byline.original: By STEPHEN CASTLE AND LIZ ALDERMAN
byline.contributor:
Stephen Castle reported from
Brussels and Liz Alderman from
Paris. Nicholas Kulish contributed
reporting from Berlin

abstract: Germany seeks to reduce expectations of an economic breakthrough, indication emerging five-point plan designed to end the euro zone's sovereign debt crisis could take months to implement.
snippet: Officials suggested that an emerging five-point plan designed to end the euro zone's sovereign debt crisis could take months to implement.
lead_paragraph: Officials suggested that an emerging five-point plan designed to end the euro zone's sovereign debt crisis could take months to implement.

headline.main: Germany Lowers Expectations for E.U. Summit
headline.print_headline: Germany Tries to Temper Hopes for Debt Meeting
